title: Intel stock drops 6% as company updates chip manufacturing plans
European Uber rival Bolt will deliver food to your door via self-driving robots
description: Ride-hailing firm Bolt will start offering food delivery via a fleet of robots supplied by U.S. robotics firm Starship Technologies.

title: Bitcoin rallies 10% to highest level in over a month as traders get bullish on ETF news
description: The price of bitcoin jumped 10% to $29,405.22, the highest point since May 6, according to CoinGecko data, extending gains from earlier in the day.

title: Global gender gap could take 131 years to close after a generation of progress was lost to Covid, WEF says
description: It could take 131 years to close the global gender gap after an "entire generation" of progress was lost to Covid-19, according to WEF.

title: FTC sues Amazon over 'deceptive' Prime sign-up and cancellation process
description: The agency claims Amazon used so-called "dark patterns" to steer users to enroll in Prime without their consent.

title: These 'A.I. humans' are letting gamers modify their voices in real time
description: Voicemod, which is based in Valencia, on Wednesday released 20 humanlike characters, ranging from a 20-something woman to an elderly man.

title: Powell expects more Fed rate hikes ahead as inflation fight 'has a long way to go'
description: Noting that inflation has cooled but "remains well above" the Fed's 2% target, Powell said the central bank still has more work to do.

title: Inside China's spy war on American corporations
description: Intelligence and law enforcement officials are issuing a stark warning to American companies: The Chinese government wants to replace you.

title: Weekly mortgage demand was flat, even as interest rates drop for the third straight week
description: The average rate on the most popular mortgage, the 30-year fixed, fell for the third straight week

title: 'We do not want only a ceasefire': EU chief calls for lasting peace in Ukraine
description: A ceasefire in Ukraine is not enough for European officials, who want to see lasting peace, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said.

title: Poland wants to boost its minimum wage by 20% — and it's got economists worried
description: Poland's government has proposed a record rise in the national minimum wage. Economists are worried it could exacerbate double-digit inflation.

title: Business in China is getting harder for European companies despite the end of Covid controls
description: European businesses in China are finding it harder to operate in the country, even after it has re-opened from Covid, the EU Chamber of Commerce in China said.

title: UK net debt hits highest level in more than 60 years, topping 100% of GDP
description: The U.K.'s public sector net debt in May exceeded 100% of GDP for the first time since 1961, the Office for National Statistics said Wednesday.

title: UK inflation exceeds expectations in May, piling pressure on the government and Bank of England
description: U.K. inflation came in hotter than expected in May as consumer prices rose by an annual 8.7%, unchanged from the previous month.

title: 'I am a fan of Modi': Elon Musk on his friendship with Indian Prime Minister Modi
description: "I am a fan of Modi," Musk admitted Tuesday in a video interview published on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's official YouTube page.

title: 'Things will just have to be accepted as tense': Saudi-Iran relations have a long way to go despite rapprochement efforts
description: The two regional powers continue to have dramatically divergent geopolitical and religious goals.

title: German energy prices are so high they're driving companies to relocate, industry body says
description: Business conditions in Germany have created a "cocktail" of obstacles for companies, according to Siegfried Russwurm from the German Industry Federation.

title: Biden labels Chinese President Xi a dictator
description: The U.S. president was speaking at a fundraiser for his re-election campaign, a day after Secretary of State Antony Blinken wrapped up his first Beijing visit.

title: Grab cuts 1,000 jobs, its biggest round of layoffs since the pandemic
description: CEO Anthony Tan said the job cuts are not a "shortcut to profitability" but will enable Grab to adapt to the competitive business environment.

title: SoftBank to shift from 'defense mode' to 'offense mode,' says CEO Masayoshi Son
description: "What I am interested in most, what I am working on most, is the AI revolution. I believe that mankind is going to be exceeded by computer or AI," said CEO Masayoshi Son.

title: Chinese EV maker Nio raises more than $700 million in capital injection from Abu Dhabi
description: Chinese electric car company Nio announced Tuesday it received $738.5 million in new capital from a fund owned by the Abu Dhabi government.

title: From ice cream to cattle feed: Here are the winners and losers as the summer heat bears down
description: With temperatures hitting all-time highs, consumers are turning to ice cream and chilled drinks to beat the heat — and analysts say some sectors could benefit.

title: India's Modi is on a landmark visit to the U.S. Here's what to expect
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to meet U.S. president Joe Biden on Thursday, and analysts say talks on defense and technology are on the agenda.

title: As growth stalls for the U.S. and China, Blinken talked up economic ties in high-stakes Beijing trip
description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken underscored the importance of the economic aspects of the bilateral relationship during his high-stakes trip to China.

title: Tesla secret configuration allows select drivers to use Autopilot, FSD without a nag to take the wheel
description: The researcher has nicknamed the feature "Elon Mode," but this is not the company's internal nomenclature for it, he said.
